portreading

Class TCPPortReader

  • java.lang.Object
    • portreading.TCPPortReader

  • public class TCPPortReader
extends java.lang.Object
    A runnable utility class that provides functionality to read from TCP sockets
    Version:
    May 23, 2013 - Initial build, May 26, 2013 Added revised timeout mechanism and bug fix to Socket connect so a bad connection does not cause the run() loop to hang waiting for a connection., July 16, 2013 Modified the input to return a byte array instead of a String, July 24, 2013 Fixed a bug in a new use of System.arrayCopy that attempted to copy the entire buffer into the final byte data array to be passed to the output queue. The copy call now only reads the number of bytes that were available at read instead of the full buffer, July 26, 2013 Extracted a version from the mainline code and adapted it for use as a debugging application to strictly read the output from a port configuration. The application now uses command line arguments to configure itself and responds with basic error messages to solve the most common problems., September 23, 2013 - Added support for an arbitrary, optional input of a delimiter - Updated licensing information
    Author:
    Joshua Dickson

    • Constructor Detail

      • TCPPortReader

        public TCPPortReader(java.lang.String socketAddress,
             int port,
             int bufferSize,
             java.lang.String printConversion,
             java.lang.String delimiter)
        Construct a TCPPortReader with the given connection and socket attributes
        Parameters:
        socketAddress - the IP address to connect the socket to
        port - the port on which to open the socket
        bufferSize - the maximum buffer size to read
        printConversion - the ascii or hex conversion
        delimiter - the delimiter to print before the port trace info
